title: Alesha Dixon sweetly cradles baby daughter Anaya on family day out
text:
Big day out for baby Anaya (Picture: SplashNews)

Alesha Dixon made the most of the Californian sun this weekend by taking her newborn daughter Anaya out for a relaxing family stroll.

The Britain’s Got Talent judge was spotted out and about in Santa Monica with her husband, Azuka Ononye, and their eldest daughter Azura.

But they had particularly special cargo with two-month-old Anaya cradled in her mother’s arms, marking the first time she has been pictured since Alesha secretly gave birth in August.

Dressed casually in loose trousers and a white Ivy Park tee, the 41-year-old TV star was seen doting all over her baby girl who was swaddled in blankets.

Alesha was pictured carefully placing her bundle of joy back in her pushchair while chatting to an unidentified woman.

After walking along the boardwalk, Alesha then shifted her attention to her eldest child Azura, six, with the pair enjoying a rollercoaster ride together on the pier.

It’s the first time Alesha has been pictured out with the newborn since announcing her arrival last week, seven weeks after she had quietly given birth.

Alesha doted all over the newborn (Picture: Splash News)

Alesha and Azuka probably aren’t getting much sleep these days (Picture: Splash News)

Little Azura was loving life (Picture: Splash News)

Alongside a close-up photo of Anaya sleeping on Azuka’s chest, Alesha wrote: ‘Anaya Safiya born 20.08.10… 7 weeks ago this little angel came into our lives! As I celebrate my birthday today I feel like the luckiest girl on the planet [sic].’

Alesha’s been balancing life with a newborn baby with her duty as a guest judge on America’s Got Talent.

Somehow, the former Mis-Teeq singer was able to pull the wool over our eyes for almost two months. But there was speculation she had already given birth when she was spotted arriving at America’s Got Talent filming without her baby bump.

It was announced in September Alesha will replace Mel B as a judge on the upcoming season of America’s Got Talent: The Champions.

At the time, she said she was ‘super excited’ to be joining the reality television show’s judging panel, which also features pal Simon Cowell, Heidi Klum and Howie Mandel.
